New Records: Quinton de Kock made the most noise, crashing 109 up top as South Africa put up 311 for 7 having been asked to bat first.
Key Match Events: Pat Cummins c Miller b Shamsi 22 (21b 4x4 0x6 29m)
Josh Hazlewood c Rabada b Shamsi 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m)
Steven Smith was given out LBW as an on-field decision was overturned on DRS despite the naked eye suggesting the ball was on its way past leg stump.
Starc shelled David Miller (on 10) at deep square leg and Stoinis botched a simpler opportunity at cover off Marco Jansen (25)
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's decision at the toss, and the moves to reinforce their batting with Josh Inglis and Marcus Stoinis drafted in for Alex Carey and Cameron Green, came to nothing.
Post-Match Reflections: It's not news that this tournament will be de Kock's last appearances in the ODI format, but it is worth remembering on nights like these. The 30-year-old is departing the scene at the peak of his powers,Hardik Pandya was not mentioned, but the article does mention that Australia have cause to lament two decisions against them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Quinton de Kock's second century in as many games lifted South Africa to 311
Australia barely got going in the chase
